    • Capture requirements from R into a conda ready metadata file

    Capture requirements from R into a conda ready metadata file

    example.Rmd
    library(anaRconda)
requirements_df <- anaRconda::capture_requirements(write = FALSE)
#> Warning in anaRconda::capture_requirements(write = FALSE): The 'file' argument is defined but 'write' is equal to FALSE.
#>  Set both filename and 'write = TRUE' to write captured requirements in a file.
#>  If 'write = FALSE', requirements metadata will be returned as a dataframe object.
#> Warning in anaRconda::capture_requirements(write = FALSE): 1 locally developed package will not be included in the requirements:
#> package name: anaRconda
#> Warning in anaRconda::capture_requirements(write = FALSE): 1  GitHub hosted R package will not be included in the requirements:
#>  package name: pkgdown
#> No CRAN or GitHub packages loaded in this workspace, check warnings for more information
requirements_df$conda_packages
#> NULL
